Definition: In this task, you will be given four sentences of a story written in natural language. Your job is to select an end sentence from (A) and (B) such that the story sounds incomplete and incoherent.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence1: Rick grew up in a troubled household. Sentence2: He never found good support in family, and turned to gangs. Sentence3: It wasn't long before Rick got shot in a robbery. Sentence4: The incident caused him to turn a new leaf. 
 (A) He is happy now. (B) He joined a gang.
Positive Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, the incident turned a new leaf to Rick's life; so, he must be happy now. Also, he was previously in gang, so, this incident cannot make him to join a gang. So, B is incorrect.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence1: Laverne needs to prepare something for her friend's party. Sentence2: She decides to bake a batch of brownies. Sentence3: She chooses a recipe and follows it closely. Sentence4: Laverne tests one of the brownies to make sure it is delicious. 
 (A) The brownies are so delicious Laverne eats two of them. (B) Laverne doesn't go to her friend's party.
Positive Examples.explanation: As mentioned in the third sentence, Laverne follows the recipe closely; brownies should be delicious and she should not cancel going to her friend's party. So, B is incorrect.

Positive Examples.input:
Sentence1: Sarah had been dreaming of visiting Europe for years. Sentence2: She had finally saved enough for the trip. Sentence3: She landed in Spain and traveled east across the continent. Sentence4: She didn't like how different everything was. 
 (A) Sarah then decided to move to Europe. (B) Sarah decided that she preferred her home over Europe.
Positive Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, Sarah didn't like that everything was different in Europe; she must have preferred her home over Europe. So, A is incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence1: Rick grew up in a troubled household. Sentence2: He never found good support in family, and turned to gangs. Sentence3: It wasn't long before Rick got shot in a robbery. Sentence4: The incident caused him to turn a new leaf. 
 (A) He is happy now. (B) He joined a gang.
Negative Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, the incident turned a new leaf to Rick's life; so, he must be happy now. However, A is correct answer, not incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence1: Laverne needs to prepare something for her friend's party. Sentence2: She decides to bake a batch of brownies. Sentence3: She chooses a recipe and follows it closely. Sentence4: Laverne tests one of the brownies to make sure it is delicious. 
 (A) The brownies are so delicious Laverne eats two of them. (B) Laverne doesn't go to her friend's party.
Negative Examples.explanation: As mentioned in the third sentence, Laverne follows the recipe closely; brownies should be delicious. However, A is correct answer, not incorrect.

Negative Examples.input:
Sentence1: Sarah had been dreaming of visiting Europe for years. Sentence2: She had finally saved enough for the trip. Sentence3: She landed in Spain and traveled east across the continent. Sentence4: She didn't like how different everything was. 
 (A) Sarah then decided to move to Europe. (B) Sarah decided that she preferred her home over Europe.
Negative Examples.explanation: As mentioned in fourth sentence, Sarah didn't like that everything was different in Europe; she must have preferred her home over Europe. However, B is correct answer, not incorrect.

Instances.input:
Sentence1: Throughout my day in school, I was completely tired. Sentence2: As my Spanish teacher taught accents, I was falling asleep. Sentence3: During lunch, I decided to rest on the bleachers in the football field. Sentence4: In addition, I fell asleep on the bus ride home. 
 (A) I decided to watch movies all night. (B) I had an early night.

Sentence1: It is usually calm and warm in the morning, in Florida. Sentence2: Yesterday morning it was very windy, though. Sentence3: The palm tree fronds were blowing so hard they scraped the windows. Sentence4: I turned on the TV and a tornado warning came on! 
 (A) A tornado came within 2 blocks of the house! (B) So I went outside to play.

Sentence1: Tracy never believed in marriage. Sentence2: Doug taught Tracy how to feel love again. Sentence3: Doug and Tracy made a commitment to each other. Sentence4: Doug broke his wedding vows to Tracy. 
 (A) Tracy was happy with Doug. (B) Tracy's apprehensions about marriage were confirmed.

Sentence1: A man ordered pancakes in a diner from the server. Sentence2: She brought him a plate of pancakes minutes later. Sentence3: The man complained that the pancakes were too thick. Sentence4: The server brought them back to the cook. 
 (A) The cook praised him. (B) The cook decided to remake the pancakes.

Sentence1: One day, police were investigating a crime scene. Sentence2: They were stuck on where to go next. Sentence3: They got a tip to check behind the library. Sentence4: There they found some key evidence. 
 (A) The police found the perpetrator and locked her up. (B) The police put on a community event to raise money.

Sentence1: Brie and her cat moved in with her boyfriend and his cat. Sentence2: The two cats hated each other. Sentence3: They spent most of their hissing each other. Sentence4: One night, six months later, the cats decided to cuddle. 
 (A) Brie was glad they had become friends. (B) Brie hated cheese.

Sentence1: Hector notices that only one ear of his headphones work. Sentence2: He wants to get a new pair so he can listen to music. Sentence3: Finally he finds a good pair of headphones that he can afford. Sentence4: He buys them and immediately starts listening to music. 
 (A) Hector decides he doesn't like music. (B) Hector is happy that both ears work.

Sentence1: Connie's doctor says she is overweight. Sentence2: She recommended better diet and exercise. Sentence3: One day, Connie joined a gym. Sentence4: The next day, Connie was disappointed to not see change. 
 (A) She was proud of her body. (B) She hired a personal trainer to help her meet her goals.
